results.title: Dr. No
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Terence Young, Albert R. Broccoli, Harry Saltzman and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Dr. No was the first extraordinary adventure of the world’s most famous spy: James Bond. Sean Connery is 007: suave, charming and fearless; an expert on weapons, women, martinis and just about everything. Dr. No, a fanatical scientist, is a member of the terrorist organisation SPECTRE, which plans to conquer the world. However, thanks to the daring of James Bond, Dr. No is ultimately defeated. Ursula Andress made her screen debut in the film. While there is no famous title song, the well-known James Bond theme, elaborate opening title sequences by Maurice Binder and the magnificent locations were present from this first film and have now become part of the James Bond legend.

results.title: Dr. Elizabeth Kubler Ross
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Monday Conference”.
Dr Elizabeth Kubler-Ross explains her treatment of the problems surrounding death and dying. She also details ways of dealing with the particular problems involved in coming to terms with the death of a young child

results.title: Dr Terror's house of horror
results.creator_credit: Paul Stone, Amicus Productions and Freddy Frances
results.brief_description: During the 1960s and 70s, Amicus Productions were one of the most popular horror movie-making studios. “Dr Terror’s house of horror” was the first Amicus film, and with its portmanteau structure, features an array of supernatural settings. In a railway carriage sit five men; a mysterious doctor joins them and offers to tell their terrible fortunes. In them, a werewolf menaces a realtor; an art critic is terrorised by the severed hand of a disgruntled artist; a third man suspects his wife is a vampire; a jazz musician is pursued by a voodoo curse; a cottage is besieged by a monster vine. With its frightening narratives, and great cast, this is a wonderfully creepy classic horror experience. Also known as “Blood suckers”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Stone, Amicus Productions and Freddy Frances

results.title: Dr Spock
results.brief_description: Presents the theories and practice of Dr. Benjamin Spock and his suggestions to parents for dealing with the problems, foibles and characteristics of children from infancy to the age of six.

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: the Zax
results.creator_credit: Ted Geisel, Isadore Freleng, DePatie-Freleng Enterprises, CBS TV and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: A north-going Zax and a south-going Zax meet face-to-face on their journeys and neither is willing to budge. Their stubbornness and inability to change are presented most humorously in this animated film based on the original illustrations.

results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: Sneetches
results.creator_credit: CBS, Isadore Freleng, Ted Geisel and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: Animated version of the Dr Seuss story from “Dr Seuss on the Loose”. This film implies that differences are only relative and in essence don’t matter. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Dr Robert Simpson
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Kenneth Vose and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Dr Robert Simpson is the director of the National Hurricane Watch Centre at the University of Miami. He discusse his responsibility for tracking hurricanes which originate in the south east Atlantic and for warning the public along the Eastern Atlantic Coast on the intensity and course which the hurricanes will takes. Narrated by Barry Sullivan. Written by Kenneth Vose.

results.title: Dr Plughole
results.brief_description: Matthew’s evening bath is interrupted by a visit from the water wizard Dr. Plughole. Combining animation and live action into comic adventure, “Dr. Plughole” shows young Matthew how exciting the water cycle is and how important it is for our everyday lives. Principles covered are evaporation, condensation and precipitation.

results.title: Dr Mabuse: the fatal passions
results.brief_description: The feature version of the two-part ‘Dr Mabuse: The Gambler’ edited into one movie. Dr. Mabuse is a master criminal and overlord of the social chaos in Berlin who uses hypnosis, disguise and deception in his quest for wealth and power. As much a social portrait as a thriller, this is an early example of the suitability of the thriller genre as a vehicle for Lang’s world view, a world in which nothing is as it seems, where danger lurks beneath the most seemingly normal circumstances and objects, and individual destinies are controlled and threatened by mysterious and powerful forces. This is an early demonstration of a key Langian theme: the complete unreliability of appearances. With English intertitles and musical accompaniment. Cast includes Rudolf Klein-Rogge, Ause Egdse Nissem, Paul Richter, Bernhard Goetzke. Reference: Julian Petley, BFI Distribution Library Catalogue. WITH MUSICAL SOUNDTRACK.
